content.text:
# Draft:Edward S. Delaplaine

Edward Schley Delaplaine (October 6, 1893 â€“ May 22, 1989) was a justice of the Maryland Court of Appeals from 1938 to 1956.
Born in Frederick, Maryland, Delaplaine attended Washington and Lee University and the University of Maryland.
"Delaplaine was chairman of the board of the Great Southern Printing and Manufacturing Co., the parent company of the Frederick News-Post and Frederick Cablevision".
Appointed to the Maryland Court of Appeals in 1938; served for 18 years.
Elected to the Maryland House of Delegates in 1915, at age 22.
Delaplaine was also an historian, and wrote about Francis Scott Key Roger B. Taney.
Delaplaine died at his home in Frederick, Maryland, at the age of 95.
